content:
**Which graph shows a quadratic function with range $f(x) \geq 4$?**


[[â˜ƒ radio 1]]

options.alt: A coordinate plane. The x- and y-axes each scale by two. A graph of a line intersects the points (negative 3, 2) and (1, negative 1).

choices.content: ![A quadratic function is graphed. The x and f of x axes go from negative 10 to 10. There are two arrows pointing up at the top edge of the graph. There is a curve between these two arrows, connecting them. From left to right, it travels down reaching a minimum f of x value at (6, 4), then travels back up to the other arrow.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/2bdcb235fde52ea13303316e29385bab49215503)

![A quadratic function is graphed. The x and f of x axes go from negative 10 to 10. There are two arrows pointing up at the top edge of the graph. There is a curve between these two arrows, connecting them. From left to right, it travels down reaching a minimum f of x value at (6, 7), then travels back up to the other arrow.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/17d747bd32f6b3e431ab4b13f3075212a6236abe)

![A quadratic function is graphed. The x and f of x axes go from negative 10 to 10. There are two arrows pointing up at the top edge of the graph. There is a curve between these two arrows, connecting them. From left to right, it travels down reaching a minimum f of x value at (6, negative 4), then travels back up to the other arrow.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/e4ae51ac61895386d2ae068e00c79b1bc1ef96a7)

![A quadratic function is graphed. The x and f of x axes go from negative 10 to 10. There are two arrows pointing up at the top edge of the graph. There is a curve between these two arrows, connecting them. From left to right, it travels down reaching a minimum f of x value at (4, negative 4), then travels back up to the other arrow.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/4484f49cc4d8aca43f85c4ebbe90ab7486455bf0)
